1.information:
**Outline:**

- Pantone Colour of the Year 2022: Very Peri (HEX: 6667AA)
- Colour
- Shape
- Harmony

**About:**

This purple can be nice and calm, or in modern games this represents poison. See how you can incorporate its mood as a colour into an art piece.
Big dots happen in a pattern and create a level of childish and relaxed atmosphere; small dots is often used for detailing like in manga halftones.

**Resources:**

- Information about Pantone's colour of the year: [here](https://www.pantone.com/color-of-the-year-2022).
- Getting in the mood stippling: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f0MOQ10QXlI).
- Purple as a colour of corruption in games: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L51xc6iqeaU).

2.information:
**Outline:**

- Miniatures
- Scale
- Contrast 

**About:**

Small things in a big world or normal objects made way smaller than they seem, playing with scale is fun and whimsical. It dips a lot into imagination and focuses on how we perceive things at a different size.

There are fantastic objects in the world that play with this see what inspires you: snow globes, bonsai trees, scale toys, and gacha toys LOL.

**Resources:**

- Scale photography using minature figures: [here](https://miniature-calendar.com/).
- Jazza's how to draw isometric art tutorial (20min): [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cdxJQFXsxXQ).
- Photographer tries out miniature photography: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S4pNVxiq-Rg).

3.information:
**Outline:**

- Windows
- Contrast
- Space

**About:**

oOOoOoo windows!!!! Often seen in media as motifs/symbolism of:
- exposing people's inner thoughts
- a transitional state between one phase and another
- being exposed to the unknown on the other side
- showing a changing of time
- being watched by a vampire a night

It's free reign of direction, so I'm curious where you want to take this!

**Resources:**
- Types of windows: [here](https://www.bradnams.com.au/product-selection/windows-doors/types-aluminium-windows/)
- Interior designer talks about curtains with windows: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vjIfZvjDlPY) (11min fun watch!)
- BEST architecture shots in movies: Windows: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h40QQ2YLMn4)

4.information:
**Outline:**

- Feline
- Pattern
- Texture

**About:**

It's true, this is a thinly veiled Lunar New Year prompt. The prompt is broad, so look into lions, tigers, chinese lions??, house cats, pumas, whatever you'd like and just run for it. Festival sets a really fun tone, maybe there's influence from Encanto?

Let's goooo

**Resources:**
- Animal Photo Art References: [here](https://x6ud.github.io/#/)
- How people celebrate Lunar New Year: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FFCljlSbWzw)
- Video of the world's smallest cat 2 min: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W86cTIoMv2U)
- Not serious but watchmojo's top 10 cat breeds LOL: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m8RMv0tkwVk)

5.information:
**Outline:**

- Drinks
- Line
- Harmony

**About:**

TECHNICALLY you don't need to drink WATER when someone says this. This week is about drinks and the containers we use to hold them. Study how they look and what different drinks mean to different people, a fun motif!

What's your drink of choice?


**Resources:**
- Watercolor Glass Bottles: From Drawing to Painting 20MIN: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2V7jed0uRNU)
- How Tea Is Enjoyed Around The World 8MIN: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZgvO--dGLjY)
- (Just for vibes LOL) 47 Drinks To Try In Your Lifetime | The Ultimate List : [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q8hfNo3HZ5g)

6.information:
**Outline:**

- What people call home/found family.
- Colour.
- Harmony.

**About:**

Aha Valentine's day! It's a day to celebrate love, not just romantic but also platonic, familial, and more. See where you have found your family or the family from media and moments that matter to you.

Good luck and hope you can draw some well worth memories!

7.information:
**Outline:**

- Landscape but in Portrait mode
- Space
- Contrast

**About:**

Landscapes are normally drawn long ways but with technology, and modern phones, we tend to see more pieces lean towards portrait mode. I wanted to take this time to see how verticality can influence a landscape shot and how the focus changes from "vastness" to "layers".

**Resources:**

- 90% of LANDSCAPE Photography in ONLY 20 minutes (13 mins onwards is good): [here](https:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=UXufuO4JjvQ)
- How to Draw a Landscape (7min): [here](https:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=6csGlE5qttg)
- Rules of Framing and Composition (8min): [here](https:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=fM64ycm7tz4)

8.information:
**Outline:**

- Blue only blue!
- Colour
- Tone

**About:**

Sad boy blues, it's about traditional art. Go check out the resources and learn about spicy sad Picasso. I might rewrite this to sound nicer, but use blue and see where it finds you.

**Resources:**

- Picasso's Blue Period (9min): [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gJCCHwexFjY).
- Blue Period - The Dichotomy between Talent and Hard Work (The Anime 17min): [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=afGn-JPmimE).
- Art Emanates From Pain and Sadness: Picasso’s Blue Period: [here](http://www.people.vcu.edu/~djbromle/modern-art/04/paulh/index.htm).

9.information:
**Outline:**

- Mona Lisa
- 2 Pieces
- 1 Hour Max of art time

**About:**

There is something incredible interesting about how the internet remakes, redesigns, and reinterprets art. Something as famous as Mona Lisa has technically been "meme-ed" to hell purely for its recognisability. This week is a short one with a 24 hour shorted deadline, so let's get to it!

How do we interpret Mona Lisa?

*note: you have 1 hour to draw 2 mona lisa, it is up to you how much time you want to spend on each.*

**Resources:**

- A Modern Ode to the Mona Lisa, Guided by Google's Hive Mind: [here](https://www.wired.com/2013/07/a-flip-book-made-from-240-google-search-mona-lisa-images/).
- Mona Lisa Britannica: [here](https://www.britannica.com/topic/Mona-Lisa-painting).

10.information:
**Outline:**

- Jewellery/Accessories
- Contrast
- Emphasis

**About:**

This week is about the things we wear! As a note, the subject does not need to be a girl but anyone/thing. Focus on the small details, earrings, rings, necklace, hair clip, and bits and bobs. Enjoy!!

**Resources:**

Will be updated!

11.information:
**Outline:**

- Text
- Space
- Balance

**About:**

Welcome to graphic design week! This week is about designing a text logo for yourself, use your username or name and create something that represents you. You can think "apple" or "nike" or you just imagine a vtuber logo for yourself.

Watch some videos and see how type affects how we interpret words.

**Resources:**

- What makes a truly great logo: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RBTiTcHm_ac)
- Logo Design – How to Improve Your Letterforms: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mJ_NPQYD8bw)
- Histories of Logo Article: [here](https://99designs.com.au/blog/design-history-movements/the-history-of-logos/#:~:text=The%20history%20of%20logos%20goes,1900s%2C%20evolving%20alongside%20mass%20printing.)

12.information:
**Outline:**

- use the beach photos!
- Texture
- Colour

**About:**

This week is a short 1 week, an experimental week for sure. There won't be a presentation until the 14th of April!

I give you 2 pictures and please use them in exploring whatever you'd like. Remove the subject of beach or use it to inspire you. This is a one week exploration prompt so create whatever you'd like!

Check the discord for the photos!

**Resources:**

- How To Make An Abstract Collage: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bE2H5iqIPrk)
- Watch this artist turn pages of magazines into surreal collages: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rzh607-fwUM)
- Beaches Around the World, From Oahu to an Island Off Sardinia: [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I7nA_XTOzQM.)

13.information:
**Outline:**

- a meme or famous piece of work
- contrast

**About:**

This week is about memes and parody!

When something becomes famous or popular it becomes a part of "pop culture" and "mainstream media". What I'm saying is what memes do you like and how does it influence your life and work. It's a pretty fun topic so see what you like... remember LOLcats? Take a meme and remake it or just meme something to bits.

Please include the original meme/reference in your submission if possible!

14.information:
**Outline:**

- facial expression
- shape
- exaggeration

**About:**

This week is on reaction faces, maybe leading from memes, maybe for the love of comedy and exaggeration.

My inspiration comes from comedy 4koma series/manga such as Love is War, Komi-san, and hinamatsuri to name a few. Something very punchline-like which is pretty fun! Enjoy!

15.information:
**Outline:**

- what inspires you

**About:**

This is the last week of the refresh! Good job for making it so far through the year.

The last prompt is about showing everyone what inspires you and seeing where it takes you!

Take your time and enjoy!
